thread.title: Arsene Wenger says Arsenal were not mentally prepared for defeat to Watford
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger says Arsenal were not mentally prepared for defeat to Watford

author: Liam Corless
title: Arsene Wenger says Arsenal were not mentally prepared for defeat to Watford
text:
Sport Arsene Wenger says Arsenal were not mentally prepared for defeat to Watford The Gunners were dealt a huge blow in the title race as Watford nicked all three points at the Emirates on Tuesday night Share Arsenal were stunned by Watford at the Emirates (Photo: PA) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger claimed Arsenal were not mentally prepared for the physically challenges posed by Watford as they went down to a shock 2-1 home defeat. 
Goals from Younes Kaboul and Troy Deeney put the Hornets into a comfortable lead in the first half. 
Alex Iwobi netted just before the hour mark to give Arsenal hope but they couldn't find an equaliser despite putting a vast amount of pressure on the visitors. 
After the match, Wenger said: "It was obvious we lost duels and were not sharp enough. It looked more mentally that we were not ready for the challenges. We were unlucky for the first goal which was deflected after a soft free-kick. It took us a while to get into the game, it was all us in the second half and unlucky not to get something from the game. Read More
